summary: 09/07/1993: Loyalist gunmen in Belfast shot dead a Catholic hairdresser in his salon. The Ulster Defence Association claimed responsibility for the killing. No one was injured in the attack.
addnotes: Mr. Hughes was the third shop-owner murdered by loyalists in the same area during the past two years.
scite1: “Loyalist Gun Gang Murder Fifth Victim," Daily Mail (London), September 8, 1993.
scite2: “Gunmen Claim Fifth Victim Since Monday," The Independent (London), September 8, 1993.
scite3: “Concern grows as another Catholic is killed - Loyalist gunmen claim fifth victim in a week of murder," The Irish Times, September 08, 1993.
